original_theorem:
Suppose that  $S$ is Jordan measurable
and $\epsilon,$  $\rho>0.$  Then there are cubes
$C_1,$ $C_2,$ \dots$,$ $C_r$ in $S$ with edge lengths $<\rho,$ such
that  $C_j\subset  S,$ $1\le j\le r,$
$C_i^0\cap C_j^0=\emptyset$ if $i\ne j,$ and
\begin{equation} \label{eq:7.3.35}
V(S)\le\sum_{j=1}^r V(C_j)+\epsilon.
\end{equation}
theorem_translation:
```lean4
theorem jordan_measurable_set_inner_approx_by_disjoint_cubes
    {n : ℕ} (S : Set (Fin n → ℝ))
    (hS_bounded : Bornology.IsBounded S) (hS_boundary_null : MeasureTheory.volume (frontier S) = 0)
    (ε ρ : ℝ) (hε : 0 < ε) (hρ : 0 < ρ) :
    ∃ (Cs : Finset (BoxIntegral.Box (Fin n))),
      (∀ C ∈ Cs, ∃ s ∈ Set.Ioo 0 ρ, ∀ i, C.upper i - C.lower i = s) ∧
      (∀ C ∈ Cs, ↑C ⊆ S) ∧
      Cs.Pairwise (Disjoint on fun C ↦ BoxIntegral.Box.Ioo C) ∧
      (MeasureTheory.volume S).toReal ≤ (∑ C in Cs, ∏ i, (C.upper i - C.lower i)) + ε := by
```

import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem jordan_measurable_set_inner_approx_by_disjoint_cubes
    {n : ℕ} (S : Set (Fin n → ℝ))
    (hS_bounded : Bornology.IsBounded S) (hS_boundary_null : MeasureTheory.volume (frontier S) = 0)
    (ε ρ : ℝ) (hε : 0 < ε) (hρ : 0 < ρ) :
    ∃ (Cs : Finset (BoxIntegral.Box (Fin n))),
      (∀ C ∈ Cs, ∃ s ∈ Set.Ioo 0 ρ, ∀ i, C.upper i - C.lower i = s) ∧
      (∀ C ∈ Cs, ↑C ⊆ S) ∧
      Cs.Pairwise (Disjoint on fun C ↦ BoxIntegral.Box.Ioo C) ∧
      (MeasureTheory.volume S).toReal ≤ (∑ C in Cs, ∏ i, (C.upper i - C.lower i)) + ε := by sorry

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
• S is a Jordan measurable set in ℝⁿ [tc_1].
Therefore, we conclude:
• For any cube C containing S, the integral of the characteristic function of S over C is equal to the volume of S, i.e., ∫_C ψ_S(X) dX = V(S) [l1].
proof_steps.lean_tactics: sorry  -- skipped due to previous failure

lean_results.lean_tactics: sorry  -- skipped due to previous failure
lean_results.error_msg: Skipped due to previous verification failure

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
• For any cube C containing S, ∫_C ψ_S(X) dX = V(S) [l1].
• ε > 0 [tc_2].
Therefore, we conclude:
• There exists a δ > 0 such that for any cube C containing S and for any partition P of C with mesh ||P|| < δ, and for any Riemann sum σ of ψ_S over P, we have σ > V(S) - ε/2 [l2].

import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem jordan_measurable_set_inner_approx_by_disjoint_cubes
    {n : ℕ} (S : Set (Fin n → ℝ))
    (hS_bounded : Bornology.IsBounded S) (hS_boundary_null : MeasureTheory.volume (frontier S) = 0)
    (ε ρ : ℝ) (hε : 0 < ε) (hρ : 0 < ρ) :
    ∃ (Cs : Finset (BoxIntegral.Box (Fin n))),
      (∀ C ∈ Cs, ∃ s ∈ Set.Ioo 0 ρ, ∀ i, C.upper i - C.lower i = s) ∧
      (∀ C ∈ Cs, ↑C ⊆ S) ∧
      Cs.Pairwise (Disjoint on fun C ↦ BoxIntegral.Box.Ioo C) ∧
      (MeasureTheory.volume S).toReal ≤ (∑ C in Cs, ∏ i, (C.upper i - C.lower i)) + ε := by
